snippet: McDonald’s, Ram Trucks, Red Bull and Mophie have all included God in TV commercials, whether to elicit sentimental feelings or for humor. But invoking religion in ads is risky.
abstract: Advertising column; advertising industry shies away from mentioning religion in ads, as it runs risk of alienating audience, yet many have found that tactful inclusion of religious motifs can sometimes pay off.
lead_paragraph: McDonald’s, Ram Trucks, Red Bull and Mophie have all included God in TV commercials, whether to elicit sentimental feelings or for humor. But invoking religion in ads is risky.

headline.print_headline: God May Forgive Ads That Offend, but Customers Probably Won’t
headline.main: God May Forgive Ads That Offend, but Customers Probably Won’t
